alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 445 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Moss Bluff, or near Emeralda. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weirsdale and The Village of Briar Meadow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
